page.title: 08RECREATION
page.content: Whipsnade Zoo. The country home of the London Zoologicl Society is sited at Whipsnade on the Dunstable Downs.The Zoo was started in 1931 and covers 600 acres of land,80 acres of which are used by a local farmer.The Zoo employs 36 keepers\groundsmen, whose job it is to feed the animals and maintain the fences and enclosures,as the animals in this Zoo are mostly kept in large paddocks in a effort to create more natural conditions for the animals. About 380,000 visitors a year come to the Zoo and they can also view the White Lion which is a giant picture of a lion 100 metres across cut into the chalkface of the Downs.At night the White Lion is lighted by 750 lamps and is a very impressive sight.
